snippet: An iPhone being stolen on the street is fairly common; police officers racing through the streets and subways while tracking it on another iPhone is not.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column describes movie-like high speed chase in which New York police officers in cruiser followed elevated No 7 train in Queens, pursuing teenage iPhone thief using Find My iPhone feature on victim's phone; thief was caught at Junction Boulevard stop, where officers were able to make phone ring in teen's back pocket by dialing victim's number.
lead_paragraph: An iPhone being stolen on the street is fairly common; police officers racing through the streets and subways while tracking it on another iPhone is not.

headline.seo: Chasing Down a GPS Blip to a Stolen iPhone
headline.main: Theft of an iPhone Sets Off a Cinematic High-Speed Chase
headline.print_headline: Theft of an iPhone Sets Off A Cinematic High-Speed Chase
